From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

charlar (first-person singular indicative present charlo, past participle charláu)

  1. alternative form of charrar

Conjugation

[edit]

Further reading

[edit]
  • “charlar”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN
  • Xosé Lluis García Arias (2002–2004), “charrar”, in Diccionario general de la lengua asturiana [General Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Spanish), Editorial Prensa Asturiana, →ISBN

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Italian ciarlare.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /t͡ʃaɾˈlaɾ/ [t͡ʃaɾˈlaɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: char‧lar

Verb

[edit]

charlar (first-person singular present charlo, first-person singular preterite charlé, past participle charlado)

  1. (intransitive) to chat, to chatter, to chitchat
    Synonym: platicar

Conjugation

[edit]

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
